metadata.dc:author: González Naranjo, F
Escaf Barmadah, S
Capdevila Hernández, J M
metadata.dc:description: An additional case of prostatic adenocarcinoma metastasizing to the skin is described. The metastatic lesions appeared late and despite surgical and hormonal castration. To our knowledge only 5 cases have been reported in the Spanish literature. Cutaneous metastasis originating from adenocarcinoma of the prostate is a sign of poor prognosis and patients die within 6 months after the appearance of the metastatic lesions. The site and route of tumor dissemination in the present case coincide with those reported in the literature.
metadata.dc:title: Metástasis cutánea de adenocarcinoma de próstata. A propósito de un caso.
[The cutaneous metastasis of prostatic adenocarcinoma. Apropos a case].
